item.text: Early in the morning, after forming a plan, the chief priests with the elders and the experts in the law and the whole Sanhedrin tied Jesus up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.

<st data-num="2532" class="">So</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="1905" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, “<st data-num="1510">Are</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> the <st data-num="935" class="">king</st><n id="2" /> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>?” He <st data-num="611" class="">replied</st>,<n id="3" /> “<st data-num="4771">You</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">say</st> so.”<n id="4" />

<st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="749">chief priests</st> began to <st data-num="2723" class="">accuse</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">repeatedly</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">So</st> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="1905" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="3825" class="">again</st>,<n id="1" /> “Have you <st data-num="3756" class="">nothing</st> to <st data-num="611">say</st>? <st data-num="1492" class="">See</st> <st data-num="4214">how many</st> <st data-num="2723" class="">charges</st> they are <st data-num="2723" class="">bringing</st> against <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>!”
But Jesus made no further reply, so that Pilate was amazed.
During the feast it was customary to release one prisoner to the people, whomever they requested.

A man <st data-num="3004" class="">named</st> <st data-num="912" class="">Barabbas</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="1210" class="">imprisoned</st> <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> <st data-num="4955" class="">rebels</st> <st data-num="3748" class="">who</st> had <st data-num="4160" class="">committed</st> <st data-num="5408" class="">murder</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">during</st> an <st data-num="4714" class="">insurrection</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st> the <st data-num="3793" class="">crowd</st> <st data-num="305">came up</st> and <st data-num="757">began</st> to <st data-num="154" class="">ask</st> Pilate to release a prisoner for <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, <st data-num="2531" class="">as</st> <st data-num="4160">was</st> his <st data-num="4160">custom</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">So</st> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="611" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>,<n id="1" /> “Do you <st data-num="2309" class="">want</st> me to <st data-num="630" class="">release</st> the <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> for <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>?”

(<st data-num="1063">For</st> he <st data-num="1097" class="">knew</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="749" class="">chief priests</st> had <st data-num="3860" class="">handed</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="3860">over</st> <st data-num="1223">because of</st> <st data-num="5355" class="">envy.)</st><n id="1" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> the <st data-num="749">chief priests</st> <st data-num="383">stirred up</st> the <st data-num="3793" class="">crowd</st> <st data-num="2443" class="">to</st> have <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="630" class="">release</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="912" class="">Barabbas</st> <st data-num="3123" class="">instead</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">So</st> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="611" class="">spoke</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="3825" class="">again</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="3767">Then</st> <st data-num="5101" class="">what</st> do you <st data-num="2309">want</st> me to <st data-num="4160" class="">do</st><n id="2" /> with the <st data-num="3739" class="">one</st> you <st data-num="3004" class="">call</st> <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>?”
<st data-num="3588">They</st> <st data-num="2896" class="">shouted</st> <st data-num="3825" class="">back</st>, “<st data-num="4717">Crucify</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>!”

<st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="5101" class="">Why</st>? <st data-num="5101" class="">What</st> has he <st data-num="4160" class="">done</st> <st data-num="2556" class="">wrong</st>?” <st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> they <st data-num="2896" class="">shouted</st> <st data-num="4057">more insistently</st>, “<st data-num="4717">Crucify</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>!”
Because he wanted to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas for them. Then, after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
So the soldiers led him into the palace (that is, the governor’s residence) and called together the whole cohort.

They <st data-num="1737" class="">put</st> a <st data-num="4209" class="">purple cloak</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1737" class="">on</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> after <st data-num="4120" class="">braiding</st><n id="2" /> a <st data-num="4735" class="">crown</st> of <st data-num="174" class="">thorns</st>,<n id="3" /> they <st data-num="4060" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="4060">on</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.

They <st data-num="757">began</st> to <st data-num="782" class="">salute</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him:</st> “<st data-num="5463">Hail</st>, <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>!”<n id="1" />

Again and again<n id="1" /> they <st data-num="5180" class="">struck</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> on the <st data-num="2776" class="">head</st> with a <st data-num="2563" class="">staff</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1716">spit on</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>. <st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st> they <st data-num="5087 1119">knelt down</st> and <st data-num="4352" class="">paid homage</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.
When they had finished mocking him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
The soldiers forced a passerby to carry his cross, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country (he was the father of Alexander and Rufus).

They <st data-num="5342" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="846" class="">Jesus</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1909" class="">to</st> a <st data-num="5117" class="">place</st> called <st data-num="1115" class="">Golgotha</st><n id="2" /> (<st data-num="3739">which</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3177" class="">translated</st>, “<st data-num="5117" class="">Place</st> of the <st data-num="2898" class="">Skull”)</st>.<n id="3" />

They <st data-num="1325" class="">offered</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="3631" class="">wine</st> <st data-num="4669">mixed with myrrh</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> he did <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2983" class="">take</st> it.
Then they crucified him and divided his clothes, throwing dice for them, to decide what each would take.

It <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="5610 5154">nine o’clock in the morning</st><n id="1" /> when they <st data-num="4717" class="">crucified</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.

The <st data-num="1923" class="">inscription</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="156" class="">charge</st> against <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="1924" class="">read</st>, “The <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>.”

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> they <st data-num="4717" class="">crucified</st> <st data-num="1417" class="">two</st> <st data-num="3027" class="">outlaws</st> <st data-num="4862" class="">with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="1188" class="">right</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">on</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="2176" class="">left</st>.<n id="1" />

Those who <st data-num="3899">passed by</st> <st data-num="987" class="">defamed</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, <st data-num="2795" class="">shaking</st> <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="2776" class="">heads</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="3758">Aha</st>! You who can <st data-num="2647" class="">destroy</st> the <st data-num="3485" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3618" class="">rebuild</st> it <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="5140" class="">three</st> <st data-num="2250" class="">days</st>,

<st data-num="4982" class="">save</st> <st data-num="4572" class="">yourself</st> and <st data-num="2597">come down</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="4716" class="">cross</st>!”<n id="1" />

<st data-num="3668">In the same way</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">even</st> the <st data-num="749">chief priests</st>—together <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="1122">experts in the law</st><n id="1" />—were <st data-num="1702" class="">mocking</st> him <st data-num="4314" class="">among</st> <st data-num="240" class="">themselves:</st><n id="2" /> “He <st data-num="4982" class="">saved</st> <st data-num="243" class="">others</st>, but he <st data-num="3756 1410">cannot</st> <st data-num="4982" class="">save</st> <st data-num="1438" class="">himself</st>!
Let the Christ, the king of Israel, come down from the cross now, that we may see and believe!” Those who were crucified with him also spoke abusively to him.
Now when it was noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
Around three o’clock Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

When <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="3936" class="">bystanders</st> <st data-num="191" class="">heard</st> it they <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="2396">Listen</st>, he is <st data-num="5455" class="">calling</st> for <st data-num="2243" class="">Elijah</st>!”<n id="1" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">someone</st> <st data-num="5143" class="">ran</st>, <st data-num="1072" class="">filled</st> a <st data-num="4699" class="">sponge</st> with <st data-num="3690" class="">sour wine</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4060" class="">put</st> it on a <st data-num="2563" class="">stick</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="4222">gave</st> it to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="4222">to drink</st>, <st data-num="3004" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="863" class="">Leave</st> him alone! Let’s <st data-num="1492" class="">see</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="2243" class="">Elijah</st> will <st data-num="2064" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="2507" class="">take</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="2507">down</st>!”

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="863">cried out</st> with a <st data-num="3173" class="">loud</st> <st data-num="5456" class="">voice</st> and <st data-num="1606">breathed his last</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> the <st data-num="3485" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="2665" class="">curtain</st><n id="1" /> was <st data-num="4977" class="">torn</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">in</st> <st data-num="1417" class="">two</st>, <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="509" class="">top</st> <st data-num="2193" class="">to</st> <st data-num="2736" class="">bottom</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">Now</st> when the <st data-num="2760">centurion</st>,<n id="1" /> who <st data-num="3936" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">in</st> <st data-num="1727" class="">front</st> of <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, <st data-num="1492" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="3779">how</st> he <st data-num="1606" class="">died</st>,<n id="2" /> he <st data-num="3004">said</st>, “<st data-num="230">Truly</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="444" class="">man</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="2316">God’s</st> <st data-num="5207" class="">Son</st>!”

There <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">women</st>, <st data-num="2334" class="">watching</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> a <st data-num="3113" class="">distance</st>. <st data-num="1722" class="">Among</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">them</st> were <st data-num="3137" class="">Mary</st> <st data-num="3094" class="">Magdalene</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3137" class="">Mary</st> the <st data-num="3384" class="">mother</st> of <st data-num="2385" class="">James</st> the <st data-num="3398" class="">younger</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> of <st data-num="2500" class="">Joses</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4539" class="">Salome</st>.
When he was in Galilee, they had followed him and given him support. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were there too.
Now when evening had already come, since it was the day of preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),

<st data-num="2501" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="575" class="">of</st> <st data-num="707" class="">Arimathea</st>, a <st data-num="2158">highly regarded</st> <st data-num="1010">member of the council</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3739" class="">who</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="846" class="">himself</st> <st data-num="4327" class="">looking forward</st> to<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="932" class="">kingdom</st> of <st data-num="2316">God</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="1525" class="">went</st> <st data-num="5111" class="">boldly</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="154">asked for</st> the <st data-num="4983" class="">body</st> of <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st>.<n id="4" />

<st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> was <st data-num="2296" class="">surprised</st> that he was <st data-num="2235" class="">already</st> <st data-num="2348">dead</st>. He<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4341" class="">called</st> the <st data-num="2760" class="">centurion</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="1905" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> he had been <st data-num="599" class="">dead</st> <st data-num="3819">for some time</st>.

When Pilate<n id="1" /> was <st data-num="1097" class="">informed</st> <st data-num="575" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="2760" class="">centurion</st>, he <st data-num="1433" class="">gave</st> the <st data-num="4430" class="">body</st> to <st data-num="2501" class="">Joseph</st>.

After Joseph<n id="1" /> <st data-num="59" class="">bought</st> a <st data-num="4616" class="">linen cloth</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2507" class="">took down</st> the body, he <st data-num="1750" class="">wrapped</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st> <st data-num="1750" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="4616" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5087" class="">placed</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> a <st data-num="3419" class="">tomb</st> <st data-num="2998" class="">cut</st> <st data-num="1537">out of</st> the <st data-num="4073" class="">rock</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st><n id="4" /> he <st data-num="4351" class="">rolled</st> a <st data-num="3037" class="">stone</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">across</st> the <st data-num="2374" class="">entrance</st><n id="5" /> of the <st data-num="3419" class="">tomb</st>.
Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where the body was placed.
